children.subject: Your recommenders will not be contacted, they should submit letters of recommendation for you by the deadline.

Do you mean they need to nominate me on their own, and I additionally mark them down as recommenders on my application? Or they send me the letter of recommendation and I include it in supporting documents? I'm confused about this process and can't find the information anywhere.
Yes, they need to nominate you on their own and you can mark them down as recommenders on your application

On the recommendation page, there is a an option to add recommender names and emails. Will they be contacted to fill out a recommendation letter, or what will be expected of them? I'm asking so I can tell them when I ask them.

history.subject: Call for Nominations for EECS Student Awards

history.content:
Dear Students,

On behalf of the EECS Student Awards Chairs, please consider nominating deserving students for this year's student awards. Nominations are due by 11:59 PM PST on Friday, February 26, 2021. You may submit nominations through the Student Awards website. You will need the student's Berkeley email address to submit a nomination, plus a nomination letter of less than one page explaining why the student is qualified for the award. A description of the awards are below:

 

Undergraduate Awards

 

Research
C.V. Ramamoorthy Distinguished Research Award
This award is for any student based on outstanding contributions to a new research area in computer science and engineering.

 

Breadth
The Samuel Silver Memorial Scholarship Award
This award is presented annually to an undergraduate or graduate who best combines intellectual achievement in science and engineering (in the classroom or in research activities) with serious humanistic and cultural interests. 

 

Academic Achievement

Arthur M.Hopkin Award (EE)
This award honors an outstanding Electrical Engineering undergraduate who demonstrates seriousness of purpose and high academic achievement. To be used by the student for furthering his/her education. Please note that we have enough funds to award multiple recipients this year.

 

Mark D. Weiser Excellence in Computing Scholarship (CS)
This scholarship provides merit-based tuition for undergraduate students pursuing degrees in Computer Science.

 

Personal Triumph

Eugene L. Lawler Prize (CS)
This prize honors a computer science undergraduate, graduate or reentry student from a disadvantaged group, such as disabled, ethnic minority, or a person who has surmounted unusual difficulties in pursuing a degree, while demonstrating academic effort.  Please note that we have enough funds to award multiple recipients this year.

 

Innovation

Timothy B. Campbell Innovation Award 

This award honors the memory of Tim Campbell, a CS PhD Student who was widely known for his innovative spirit, creativity, and cross-functional collaboration.  This award is presented to an undergraduate or graduate student who demonstrates a spirit of innovation, collaboration, and creativity through her or his research and personal life.

 

James H. Eaton Memorial Scholarship 
This award is for an undergraduate student who has demonstrated a keen sense of creativity and inventiveness.

 

 

Military Service
James Tullock Memorial Scholarship
This scholarship is intended for undergraduate and graduate students who are veterans of any branch of the U.S. Armed Forces.

 

Design

Warren Dere Design Award 
This award presented to a graduating senior whose accomplishment in engineering design is judged to be most outstanding. Evidence might include accomplishments during a co-op or internship assignment or on a summer job, or achievements on a project for an upper division design course.

 

Nonlinear Science

Leon O. Chua Award 
This award is presented annually to an undergraduate or graduate student, or to a recent alumnus, for outstanding achievement in an area of nonlinear science from any discipline, including biological, engineering, mathematical, physical and social sciences. 

 

Technology in Support of Service

Kevin K. Gong Memorial Scholarship for Bright Minds and Big Hearts

The Kevin K. Gong Memorial Scholarship for Bright Minds and Big Hearts will provide student support to rising sophomores - seniors who are passionate about using technology to better the world in the College of Engineering at the University of California, Berkeley. This scholarship was established in 2015.

 

 

Graduate Awards

 

Research

David J. Sakrison Memorial Prize
This prize is offered annually to a graduate student who has completed what is deemed by a faculty committee to be a truly outstanding piece of research. 

 

C.V. Ramamoorthy Distinguished Research Award 
This award can be made to any student based on outstanding contributions to a new research area in computer science and engineering.

 

Breadth
The Samuel Silver Memorial Scholarship Award
This award is presented annually to an undergraduate or graduate who best combines intellectual achievement in science and engineering (in the classroom or in research activities) with serious humanistic and cultural interests. 

 

Altruism
The Demetri Angelakos Memorial Achievement Award 
This award is presented annually to a graduate student who is beyond the preliminary examination and is proceeding to a doctoral degree. The purpose of the award is to recognize a student who, in addition to conducting his/her research, unselfishly takes the time to help colleagues beyond the normal cooperation existing between fellow students.

 

Entrepreneurship

Sevin Rosen Funds Award for Innovation
This award recognizes innovative technical achievement with potential for entrepreneurial success, awarded annually to a graduate student based on outstanding technical achievement in a research area in computer sciences or electrical engineering.

 

Innovation

Timothy B. Campbell Innovation Award 

This new award honors the memory of Tim Campbell, a CS PhD Student who was widely known for his innovative spirit, creativity, and cross-functional collaboration.  This award is presented to an undergraduate or graduate student who demonstrates a spirit of innovation, collaboration, and creativity through her or his research and personal life.

 

Personal Triumph

Eugene L. Lawler Prize (CS)
This prize honors a computer science undergraduate, graduate or reentry student from a disadvantaged group, such as disabled, ethnic minority, or a person who has surmounted unusual difficulties in pursuing a degree and has demonstrated academic effort.

 

Military Service

James Tullock Memorial Scholarship
This scholarship is intended for undergraduate and graduate students who are veterans of any branch of the U.S. Armed Forces.

Soft Computing and its Applications

The Lofti A. Zadeh Prize

In honor of EECS Professor Lotfi A. Zadeh, this prize is to be awarded to a graduating PhD for outstanding contributions to soft computing and its applications.

 

Systems, Communications, Control/Signal Processing

Eli Jury Award
This award is presented to a graduate student or recent alumnus for outstanding achievement in the area of Systems, Communications, Control, or Signal Processing.

 

Nonlinear Science

Leon O. Chua Award  
This award is presented annually to an undergraduate or graduate student, or to a recent alumnus, for outstanding achievement in an area of nonlinear science from any discipline, including biological, engineering, mathematical, physical, and social sciences. 

 

_________________________________________________

Submit a Nomination: https://buffy.eecs.berkeley.edu/PHP/awardapp/menu.php?dept=eecs 

 

*Nominations Due 11:59 PM PST Friday, February 26, 2021*
